040package org.jfree.chart.axis;
041
042import java.awt.Graphics2D;
043import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
044import java.text.DecimalFormat;
045import java.text.NumberFormat;
046import java.util.List;
047
048import org.jfree.chart.plot.Plot;
049import org.jfree.chart.plot.ValueAxisPlot;
050import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleEdge;
051import org.jfree.chart.text.TextAnchor;
052import org.jfree.data.Range;
053
054/**
055 * A numerical axis that uses a logarithmic scale.
056 */
057public class LogarithmicAxis extends NumberAxis {
058
059    private LogarithmicAxisProduct logarithmicAxisProduct = new LogarithmicAxisProduct();
060
061        /** For serialization. */
062    private static final long serialVersionUID = 2502918599004103054L;
063
064    /** Useful constant for log(10). */
065    public static final double LOG10_VALUE = Math.log(10.0);
066
067    /** Smallest arbitrarily-close-to-zero value allowed. */
068    public static final double SMALL_LOG_VALUE = 1e-100;
069
070    /** Flag set true to allow negative values in data. */
071    protected boolean allowNegativesFlag = false;
072
073    /**
074     * Flag set true make axis throw exception if any values are &lt;= 0 and 
075     * 'allowNegativesFlag' is false.
076     */
077    protected boolean strictValuesFlag = true;
078
079    /** Number formatter for generating numeric strings. */
080    protected final NumberFormat numberFormatterObj
081        = NumberFormat.getInstance();
082
083    /** Flag set true for "1e#"-style tick labels. */
084    protected boolean expTickLabelsFlag = false;
085
086    /** Flag set true for "10^n"-style tick labels. */
087    protected boolean log10TickLabelsFlag = false;
088
089    /** True to make 'autoAdjustRange()' select "10^n" values. */
090    protected boolean autoRangeNextLogFlag = false;
091
092    /**
093     * Creates a new axis.
094     *
095     * @param label  the axis label.
096     */
097    public LogarithmicAxis(String label) {
098        super(label);
099        setupNumberFmtObj();      //setup number formatter obj
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Sets the 'allowNegativesFlag' flag; true to allow negative values
104     * in data, false to be able to plot positive values arbitrarily close to
105     * zero.
106     *
107     * @param flgVal  the new value of the flag.
108     */
109    public void setAllowNegativesFlag(boolean flgVal) {
110        this.allowNegativesFlag = flgVal;
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Returns the 'allowNegativesFlag' flag; true to allow negative values
115     * in data, false to be able to plot positive values arbitrarily close
116     * to zero.
117     *
118     * @return The flag.
119     */
120    public boolean getAllowNegativesFlag() {
121        return this.allowNegativesFlag;
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * Sets the 'strictValuesFlag' flag; if true and 'allowNegativesFlag'
126     * is false then this axis will throw a runtime exception if any of its
127     * values are less than or equal to zero; if false then the axis will
128     * adjust for values less than or equal to zero as needed.
129     *
130     * @param flgVal true for strict enforcement.
131     */
132    public void setStrictValuesFlag(boolean flgVal) {
133        this.strictValuesFlag = flgVal;
134    }
135
136    /**
137     * Returns the 'strictValuesFlag' flag; if true and 'allowNegativesFlag'
138     * is false then this axis will throw a runtime exception if any of its
139     * values are less than or equal to zero; if false then the axis will
140     * adjust for values less than or equal to zero as needed.
141     *
142     * @return {@code true} if strict enforcement is enabled.
143     */
144    public boolean getStrictValuesFlag() {
145        return this.strictValuesFlag;
146    }
147
148    /**
149     * Sets the 'expTickLabelsFlag' flag.  If the 'log10TickLabelsFlag'
150     * is false then this will set whether or not "1e#"-style tick labels
151     * are used.  The default is to use regular numeric tick labels.
152     *
153     * @param flgVal true for "1e#"-style tick labels, false for
154     * log10 or regular numeric tick labels.
155     */
156    public void setExpTickLabelsFlag(boolean flgVal) {
157        this.expTickLabelsFlag = flgVal;
158        setupNumberFmtObj();             //setup number formatter obj
159    }
160
161    /**
162     * Returns the 'expTickLabelsFlag' flag.
163     *
164     * @return {@code true} for "1e#"-style tick labels,
165     *         {@code false} for log10 or regular numeric tick labels.
166     */
167    public boolean getExpTickLabelsFlag() {
168      return this.expTickLabelsFlag;
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Sets the 'log10TickLabelsFlag' flag.  The default value is false.
173     *
174     * @param flag true for "10^n"-style tick labels, false for "1e#"-style
175     * or regular numeric tick labels.
176     */
177    public void setLog10TickLabelsFlag(boolean flag) {
178        this.log10TickLabelsFlag = flag;
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Returns the 'log10TickLabelsFlag' flag.
183     *
184     * @return {@code true} for "10^n"-style tick labels,
185     *         {@code false} for "1e#"-style or regular numeric tick
186     *         labels.
187     */
188    public boolean getLog10TickLabelsFlag() {
189        return this.log10TickLabelsFlag;
190    }
191
192    /**
193     * Sets the 'autoRangeNextLogFlag' flag.  This determines whether or
194     * not the 'autoAdjustRange()' method will select the next "10^n"
195     * values when determining the upper and lower bounds.  The default
196     * value is false.
197     *
198     * @param flag {@code true} to make the 'autoAdjustRange()'
199     * method select the next "10^n" values, {@code false} to not.
200     */
201    public void setAutoRangeNextLogFlag(boolean flag) {
202        this.autoRangeNextLogFlag = flag;
203    }
204
205    /**
206     * Returns the 'autoRangeNextLogFlag' flag.
207     *
208     * @return {@code true} if the 'autoAdjustRange()' method will
209     * select the next "10^n" values, {@code false} if not.
210     */
211    public boolean getAutoRangeNextLogFlag() {
212        return this.autoRangeNextLogFlag;
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * Overridden version that calls original and then sets up flag for
217     * log axis processing.
218     *
219     * @param range  the new range.
220     */
221    @Override
222    public void setRange(Range range) {
223        super.setRange(range);      // call parent method
224        setupSmallLogFlag();        // setup flag based on bounds values
225    }
226
227    /**
228     * Sets up flag for log axis processing.  Set true if negative values
229     * not allowed and the lower bound is between 0 and 10.
230     */
231    protected void setupSmallLogFlag() {
232        // set flag true if negative values not allowed and the
233        // lower bound is between 0 and 10:
234        double lowerVal = getRange().getLowerBound();
235        logarithmicAxisProduct.setSmallLogFlag((!this.allowNegativesFlag && lowerVal < 10.0 && lowerVal > 0.0));
236    }
237
238    /**
239     * Sets up the number formatter object according to the
240     * 'expTickLabelsFlag' flag.
241     */
242    protected void setupNumberFmtObj() {
243        if (this.numberFormatterObj instanceof DecimalFormat) {
244            //setup for "1e#"-style tick labels or regular
245            // numeric tick labels, depending on flag:
246            ((DecimalFormat) this.numberFormatterObj).applyPattern(
247                    this.expTickLabelsFlag ? "0E0" : "0.###");
248        }
249    }
250
251    /**
252     * Returns the log10 value, depending on if values between 0 and
253     * 1 are being plotted.  If negative values are not allowed and
254     * the lower bound is between 0 and 10 then a normal log is
255     * returned; otherwise the returned value is adjusted if the
256     * given value is less than 10.
257     *
258     * @param val the value.
259     *
260     * @return log<sub>10</sub>(val).
261     *
262     * @see #switchedPow10(double)
263     */
264    protected double switchedLog10(double val) {
265        return logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(val);
266    }
267
268    /**
269     * Returns a power of 10, depending on if values between 0 and
270     * 1 are being plotted.  If negative values are not allowed and
271     * the lower bound is between 0 and 10 then a normal power is
272     * returned; otherwise the returned value is adjusted if the
273     * given value is less than 1.
274     *
275     * @param val the value.
276     *
277     * @return 10<sup>val</sup>.
278     * 
279     * @see #switchedLog10(double)
280     */
281    public double switchedPow10(double val) {
282        return logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedPow10(val);
283    }
284
285    /**
286     * Returns an adjusted log10 value for graphing purposes.  The first
287     * adjustment is that negative values are changed to positive during
288     * the calculations, and then the answer is negated at the end.  The
289     * second is that, for values less than 10, an increasingly large
290     * (0 to 1) scaling factor is added such that at 0 the value is
291     * adjusted to 1, resulting in a returned result of 0.
292     *
293     * @param val  value for which log10 should be calculated.
294     *
295     * @return An adjusted log<sub>10</sub>(val).
296     *
297     * @see #adjustedPow10(double)
298     */
299    public double adjustedLog10(double val) {
300        return logarithmicAxisProduct.adjustedLog10(val);
301    }
302
303    /**
304     * Returns an adjusted power of 10 value for graphing purposes.  The first
305     * adjustment is that negative values are changed to positive during
306     * the calculations, and then the answer is negated at the end.  The
307     * second is that, for values less than 1, a progressive logarithmic
308     * offset is subtracted such that at 0 the returned result is also 0.
309     *
310     * @param val  value for which power of 10 should be calculated.
311     *
312     * @return An adjusted 10<sup>val</sup>.
313     * 
314     * @see #adjustedLog10(double)
315     */
316    public double adjustedPow10(double val) {
317        return logarithmicAxisProduct.adjustedPow10(val);
318    }
319
320    /**
321     * Returns the largest (closest to positive infinity) double value that is
322     * not greater than the argument, is equal to a mathematical integer and
323     * satisfying the condition that log base 10 of the value is an integer
324     * (i.e., the value returned will be a power of 10: 1, 10, 100, 1000, etc.).
325     *
326     * @param lower a double value below which a floor will be calcualted.
327     *
328     * @return 10<sup>N</sup> with N .. { 1 ... }
329     */
330    protected double computeLogFloor(double lower) {
331
332        double logFloor;
333        if (this.allowNegativesFlag) {
334            //negative values are allowed
335            if (lower > 10.0) {   //parameter value is > 10
336                // The Math.log() function is based on e not 10.
337                logFloor = Math.log(lower) / LOG10_VALUE;
338                logFloor = Math.floor(logFloor);
339                logFloor = Math.pow(10, logFloor);
340            }
341            else if (lower < -10.0) {   //parameter value is < -10
342                //calculate log using positive value:
343                logFloor = Math.log(-lower) / LOG10_VALUE;
344                //calculate floor using negative value:
345                logFloor = Math.floor(-logFloor);
346                //calculate power using positive value; then negate
347                logFloor = -Math.pow(10, -logFloor);
348            }
349            else {
350                //parameter value is -10 > val < 10
351                logFloor = Math.floor(lower);   //use as-is
352            }
353        }
354        else {
355            //negative values not allowed
356            if (lower > 0.0) {   //parameter value is > 0
357                // The Math.log() function is based on e not 10.
358                logFloor = Math.log(lower) / LOG10_VALUE;
359                logFloor = Math.floor(logFloor);
360                logFloor = Math.pow(10, logFloor);
361            }
362            else {
363                //parameter value is <= 0
364                logFloor = Math.floor(lower);   //use as-is
365            }
366        }
367        return logFloor;
368    }
369
370    /**
371     * Returns the smallest (closest to negative infinity) double value that is
372     * not less than the argument, is equal to a mathematical integer and
373     * satisfying the condition that log base 10 of the value is an integer
374     * (i.e., the value returned will be a power of 10: 1, 10, 100, 1000, etc.).
375     *
376     * @param upper a double value above which a ceiling will be calcualted.
377     *
378     * @return 10<sup>N</sup> with N .. { 1 ... }
379     */
380    protected double computeLogCeil(double upper) {
381
382        double logCeil;
383        if (this.allowNegativesFlag) {
384            //negative values are allowed
385            if (upper > 10.0) {
386                //parameter value is > 10
387                // The Math.log() function is based on e not 10.
388                logCeil = Math.log(upper) / LOG10_VALUE;
389                logCeil = Math.ceil(logCeil);
390                logCeil = Math.pow(10, logCeil);
391            }
392            else if (upper < -10.0) {
393                //parameter value is < -10
394                //calculate log using positive value:
395                logCeil = Math.log(-upper) / LOG10_VALUE;
396                //calculate ceil using negative value:
397                logCeil = Math.ceil(-logCeil);
398                //calculate power using positive value; then negate
399                logCeil = -Math.pow(10, -logCeil);
400            }
401            else {
402               //parameter value is -10 > val < 10
403               logCeil = Math.ceil(upper);     //use as-is
404            }
405        }
406        else {
407            //negative values not allowed
408            if (upper > 0.0) {
409                //parameter value is > 0
410                // The Math.log() function is based on e not 10.
411                logCeil = Math.log(upper) / LOG10_VALUE;
412                logCeil = Math.ceil(logCeil);
413                logCeil = Math.pow(10, logCeil);
414            }
415            else {
416                //parameter value is <= 0
417                logCeil = Math.ceil(upper);     //use as-is
418            }
419        }
420        return logCeil;
421    }
422
423    /**
424     * Rescales the axis to ensure that all data is visible.
425     */
426    @Override
427    public void autoAdjustRange() {
428
429        Plot plot = getPlot();
430        if (plot == null) {
431            return;  // no plot, no data.
432        }
433
434        if (plot instanceof ValueAxisPlot) {
435            ValueAxisPlot vap = (ValueAxisPlot) plot;
436
437            double lower;
438            Range r = vap.getDataRange(this);
439            if (r == null) {
440                   //no real data present
441                r = getDefaultAutoRange();
442                lower = r.getLowerBound();    //get lower bound value
443            }
444            else {
445                //actual data is present
446                lower = r.getLowerBound();    //get lower bound value
447                if (this.strictValuesFlag
448                        && !this.allowNegativesFlag && lower <= 0.0) {
449                    //strict flag set, allow-negatives not set and values <= 0
450                    throw new RuntimeException("Values less than or equal to "
451                            + "zero not allowed with logarithmic axis");
452                }
453            }
454
455            //apply lower margin by decreasing lower bound:
456            final double lowerMargin;
457            if (lower > 0.0 && (lowerMargin = getLowerMargin()) > 0.0) {
458                   //lower bound and margin OK; get log10 of lower bound
459                final double logLower = (Math.log(lower) / LOG10_VALUE);
460                double logAbs;      //get absolute value of log10 value
461                if ((logAbs = Math.abs(logLower)) < 1.0) {
462                    logAbs = 1.0;     //if less than 1.0 then make it 1.0
463                }              //subtract out margin and get exponential value:
464                lower = Math.pow(10, (logLower - (logAbs * lowerMargin)));
465            }
466
467            //if flag then change to log version of lowest value
468            // to make range begin at a 10^n value:
469            if (this.autoRangeNextLogFlag) {
470                lower = computeLogFloor(lower);
471            }
472
473            if (!this.allowNegativesFlag && lower >= 0.0
474                    && lower < SMALL_LOG_VALUE) {
475                //negatives not allowed and lower range bound is zero
476                lower = r.getLowerBound();    //use data range bound instead
477            }
478
479            double upper = r.getUpperBound();
480
481             //apply upper margin by increasing upper bound:
482            final double upperMargin;
483            if (upper > 0.0 && (upperMargin = getUpperMargin()) > 0.0) {
484                   //upper bound and margin OK; get log10 of upper bound
485                final double logUpper = (Math.log(upper) / LOG10_VALUE);
486                double logAbs;      //get absolute value of log10 value
487                if ((logAbs = Math.abs(logUpper)) < 1.0) {
488                    logAbs = 1.0;     //if less than 1.0 then make it 1.0
489                }              //add in margin and get exponential value:
490                upper = Math.pow(10, (logUpper + (logAbs * upperMargin)));
491            }
492
493            if (!this.allowNegativesFlag && upper < 1.0 && upper > 0.0
494                    && lower > 0.0) {
495                //negatives not allowed and upper bound between 0 & 1
496                //round up to nearest significant digit for bound:
497                //get negative exponent:
498                double expVal = Math.log(upper) / LOG10_VALUE;
499                expVal = Math.ceil(-expVal + 0.001); //get positive exponent
500                expVal = Math.pow(10, expVal);      //create multiplier value
501                //multiply, round up, and divide for bound value:
502                upper = (expVal > 0.0) ? Math.ceil(upper * expVal) / expVal
503                    : Math.ceil(upper);
504            }
505            else {
506                //negatives allowed or upper bound not between 0 & 1
507                //if flag then change to log version of highest value to
508                // make range begin at a 10^n value; else use nearest int
509                upper = (this.autoRangeNextLogFlag) ? computeLogCeil(upper)
510                    : Math.ceil(upper);
511            }
512            // ensure the autorange is at least <minRange> in size...
513            double minRange = getAutoRangeMinimumSize();
514            if (upper - lower < minRange) {
515                upper = (upper + lower + minRange) / 2;
516                lower = (upper + lower - minRange) / 2;
517                //if autorange still below minimum then adjust by 1%
518                // (can be needed when minRange is very small):
519                if (upper - lower < minRange) {
520                    double absUpper = Math.abs(upper);
521                    //need to account for case where upper==0.0
522                    double adjVal = (absUpper > SMALL_LOG_VALUE) ? absUpper
523                        / 100.0 : 0.01;
524                    upper = (upper + lower + adjVal) / 2;
525                    lower = (upper + lower - adjVal) / 2;
526                }
527            }
528
529            setRange(new Range(lower, upper), false, false);
530            setupSmallLogFlag();       //setup flag based on bounds values
531        }
532    }
533
534    /**
535     * Converts a data value to a coordinate in Java2D space, assuming that
536     * the axis runs along one edge of the specified plotArea.
537     * Note that it is possible for the coordinate to fall outside the
538     * plotArea.
539     *
540     * @param value  the data value.
541     * @param plotArea  the area for plotting the data.
542     * @param edge  the axis location.
543     *
544     * @return The Java2D coordinate.
545     */
546    @Override
547    public double valueToJava2D(double value, Rectangle2D plotArea,
548                                RectangleEdge edge) {
549
550        Range range = getRange();
551        double axisMin = logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(range.getLowerBound());
552        double axisMax = logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(range.getUpperBound());
553
554        double min = 0.0;
555        double max = 0.0;
556        if (RectangleEdge.isTopOrBottom(edge)) {
557            min = plotArea.getMinX();
558            max = plotArea.getMaxX();
559        }
560        else if (RectangleEdge.isLeftOrRight(edge)) {
561            min = plotArea.getMaxY();
562            max = plotArea.getMinY();
563        }
564
565        value = logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(value);
566
567        if (isInverted()) {
568            return max - (((value - axisMin) / (axisMax - axisMin))
569                    * (max - min));
570        }
571        else {
572            return min + (((value - axisMin) / (axisMax - axisMin))
573                    * (max - min));
574        }
575
576    }
577
578    /**
579     * Converts a coordinate in Java2D space to the corresponding data
580     * value, assuming that the axis runs along one edge of the specified
581     * plotArea.
582     *
583     * @param java2DValue  the coordinate in Java2D space.
584     * @param plotArea  the area in which the data is plotted.
585     * @param edge  the axis location.
586     *
587     * @return The data value.
588     */
589    @Override
590    public double java2DToValue(double java2DValue, Rectangle2D plotArea,
591                                RectangleEdge edge) {
592
593        Range range = getRange();
594        double axisMin = logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(range.getLowerBound());
595        double axisMax = logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(range.getUpperBound());
596
597        double plotMin = 0.0;
598        double plotMax = 0.0;
599        if (RectangleEdge.isTopOrBottom(edge)) {
600            plotMin = plotArea.getX();
601            plotMax = plotArea.getMaxX();
602        }
603        else if (RectangleEdge.isLeftOrRight(edge)) {
604            plotMin = plotArea.getMaxY();
605            plotMax = plotArea.getMinY();
606        }
607
608        if (isInverted()) {
609            return logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedPow10(axisMax - ((java2DValue - plotMin)
610                    / (plotMax - plotMin)) * (axisMax - axisMin));
611        }
612        else {
613            return logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedPow10(axisMin + ((java2DValue - plotMin)
614                    / (plotMax - plotMin)) * (axisMax - axisMin));
615        }
616    }
617
618    /**
619     * Zooms in on the current range.
620     *
621     * @param lowerPercent  the new lower bound.
622     * @param upperPercent  the new upper bound.
623     */
624    @Override
625    public void zoomRange(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent) {
626        double startLog = logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(getRange().getLowerBound());
627        double lengthLog = logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(getRange().getUpperBound()) - startLog;
628        Range adjusted;
629
630        if (isInverted()) {
631            adjusted = new Range(
632                    logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedPow10(startLog + (lengthLog * (1 - upperPercent))),
633                    logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedPow10(startLog + (lengthLog * (1 - lowerPercent))));
634        }
635        else {
636            adjusted = new Range(
637                    logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedPow10(startLog + (lengthLog * lowerPercent)),
638                    logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedPow10(startLog + (lengthLog * upperPercent)));
639        }
640
641        setRange(adjusted);
642    }
643
644    /**
645     * Calculates the positions of the tick labels for the axis, storing the
646     * results in the tick label list (ready for drawing).
647     *
648     * @param g2  the graphics device.
649     * @param dataArea  the area in which the plot should be drawn.
650     * @param edge  the location of the axis.
651     *
652     * @return A list of ticks.
653     */
654    @Override
655    protected List refreshTicksHorizontal(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
656            RectangleEdge edge) {
657
658        List ticks = new java.util.ArrayList();
659        Range range = getRange();
660
661        //get lower bound value:
662        double lowerBoundVal = range.getLowerBound();
663              //if small log values and lower bound value too small
664              // then set to a small value (don't allow <= 0):
665        if (this.logarithmicAxisProduct.getSmallLogFlag() && lowerBoundVal < SMALL_LOG_VALUE) {
666            lowerBoundVal = SMALL_LOG_VALUE;
667        }
668
669        //get upper bound value
670        double upperBoundVal = range.getUpperBound();
671
672        //get log10 version of lower bound and round to integer:
673        int iBegCount = (int) Math.rint(logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(lowerBoundVal));
674        //get log10 version of upper bound and round to integer:
675        int iEndCount = (int) Math.rint(logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(upperBoundVal));
676
677        if (iBegCount == iEndCount && iBegCount > 0
678                && Math.pow(10, iBegCount) > lowerBoundVal) {
679              //only 1 power of 10 value, it's > 0 and its resulting
680              // tick value will be larger than lower bound of data
681            --iBegCount;       //decrement to generate more ticks
682        }
683
684        double currentTickValue;
685        String tickLabel;
686        boolean zeroTickFlag = false;
687        for (int i = iBegCount; i <= iEndCount; i++) {
688            //for each power of 10 value; create ten ticks
689            for (int j = 0; j < 10; ++j) {
690                //for each tick to be displayed
691                if (this.logarithmicAxisProduct.getSmallLogFlag()) {
692                    //small log values in use; create numeric value for tick
693                    currentTickValue = Math.pow(10, i) + (Math.pow(10, i) * j);
694                    if (this.expTickLabelsFlag
695                        || (i < 0 && currentTickValue > 0.0
696                        && currentTickValue < 1.0)) {
697                        //showing "1e#"-style ticks or negative exponent
698                        // generating tick value between 0 & 1; show fewer
699                        if (j == 0 || (i > -4 && j < 2)
700                                   || currentTickValue >= upperBoundVal) {
701                          //first tick of series, or not too small a value and
702                          // one of first 3 ticks, or last tick to be displayed
703                            // set exact number of fractional digits to be shown
704                            // (no effect if showing "1e#"-style ticks):
705                            this.numberFormatterObj
706                                .setMaximumFractionDigits(-i);
707                               //create tick label (force use of fmt obj):
708                            tickLabel = makeTickLabel(currentTickValue, true);
709                        }
710                        else {    //no tick label to be shown
711                            tickLabel = "";
712                        }
713                    }
714                    else {     //tick value not between 0 & 1
715                               //show tick label if it's the first or last in
716                               // the set, or if it's 1-5; beyond that show
717                               // fewer as the values get larger:
718                        tickLabel = (j < 1 || (i < 1 && j < 5) || (j < 4 - i)
719                                         || currentTickValue >= upperBoundVal)
720                                         ? makeTickLabel(currentTickValue) : "";
721                    }
722                }
723                else { //not small log values in use; allow for values <= 0
724                    if (zeroTickFlag) {   //if did zero tick last iter then
725                        --j;              //decrement to do 1.0 tick now
726                    }     //calculate power-of-ten value for tick:
727                    currentTickValue = (i >= 0)
728                        ? Math.pow(10, i) + (Math.pow(10, i) * j)
729                        : -(Math.pow(10, -i) - (Math.pow(10, -i - 1) * j));
730                    if (!zeroTickFlag) {  // did not do zero tick last iteration
731                        if (Math.abs(currentTickValue - 1.0) < 0.0001
732                            && lowerBoundVal <= 0.0 && upperBoundVal >= 0.0) {
733                            //tick value is 1.0 and 0.0 is within data range
734                            currentTickValue = 0.0;     //set tick value to zero
735                            zeroTickFlag = true;        //indicate zero tick
736                        }
737                    }
738                    else {     //did zero tick last iteration
739                        zeroTickFlag = false;         //clear flag
740                    }               //create tick label string:
741                               //show tick label if "1e#"-style and it's one
742                               // of the first two, if it's the first or last
743                               // in the set, or if it's 1-5; beyond that
744                               // show fewer as the values get larger:
745                    tickLabel = ((this.expTickLabelsFlag && j < 2)
746                                || j < 1
747                                || (i < 1 && j < 5) || (j < 4 - i)
748                                || currentTickValue >= upperBoundVal)
749                                   ? makeTickLabel(currentTickValue) : "";
750                }
751
752                if (currentTickValue > upperBoundVal) {
753                    return ticks;   // if past highest data value then exit
754                                    // method
755                }
756
757                if (currentTickValue >= lowerBoundVal - SMALL_LOG_VALUE) {
758                    Tick tick = tick(edge, currentTickValue, tickLabel);
759                                        ticks.add(tick);
760                }
761            }
762        }
763        return ticks;
764
765    }
766
767        private Tick tick(RectangleEdge edge, double currentTickValue, String tickLabel) {
768                TextAnchor anchor;
769                TextAnchor rotationAnchor;
770                double angle = 0.0;
771                if (isVerticalTickLabels()) {
772                        anchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_RIGHT;
773                        rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_RIGHT;
774                        if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP) {
775                                angle = Math.PI / 2.0;
776                        } else {
777                                angle = -Math.PI / 2.0;
778                        }
779                } else {
780                        if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP) {
781                                anchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
782                                rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
783                        } else {
784                                anchor = TextAnchor.TOP_CENTER;
785                                rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.TOP_CENTER;
786                        }
787                }
788                Tick tick = new NumberTick(currentTickValue, tickLabel, anchor, rotationAnchor, angle);
789                return tick;
790        }
791
792    /**
793     * Calculates the positions of the tick labels for the axis, storing the
794     * results in the tick label list (ready for drawing).
795     *
796     * @param g2  the graphics device.
797     * @param dataArea  the area in which the plot should be drawn.
798     * @param edge  the location of the axis.
799     *
800     * @return A list of ticks.
801     */
802    @Override
803    protected List refreshTicksVertical(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
804            RectangleEdge edge) {
805
806        List ticks = new java.util.ArrayList();
807
808        //get lower bound value:
809        double lowerBoundVal = getRange().getLowerBound();
810        //if small log values and lower bound value too small
811        // then set to a small value (don't allow <= 0):
812        if (this.logarithmicAxisProduct.getSmallLogFlag() && lowerBoundVal < SMALL_LOG_VALUE) {
813            lowerBoundVal = SMALL_LOG_VALUE;
814        }
815        //get upper bound value
816        double upperBoundVal = getRange().getUpperBound();
817
818        //get log10 version of lower bound and round to integer:
819        int iBegCount = (int) Math.rint(logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(lowerBoundVal));
820        //get log10 version of upper bound and round to integer:
821        int iEndCount = (int) Math.rint(logarithmicAxisProduct.switchedLog10(upperBoundVal));
822
823        if (iBegCount == iEndCount && iBegCount > 0
824                && Math.pow(10, iBegCount) > lowerBoundVal) {
825              //only 1 power of 10 value, it's > 0 and its resulting
826              // tick value will be larger than lower bound of data
827            --iBegCount;       //decrement to generate more ticks
828        }
829
830        double tickVal;
831        String tickLabel;
832        boolean zeroTickFlag = false;
833        for (int i = iBegCount; i <= iEndCount; i++) {
834            //for each tick with a label to be displayed
835            int jEndCount = 10;
836            if (i == iEndCount) {
837                jEndCount = 1;
838            }
839
840            for (int j = 0; j < jEndCount; j++) {
841                //for each tick to be displayed
842                if (this.logarithmicAxisProduct.getSmallLogFlag()) {
843                    //small log values in use
844                    tickVal = Math.pow(10, i) + (Math.pow(10, i) * j);
845                    if (j == 0) {
846                        //first tick of group; create label text
847                        if (this.log10TickLabelsFlag) {
848                            //if flag then
849                            tickLabel = "10^" + i;   //create "log10"-type label
850                        }
851                        else {    //not "log10"-type label
852                            if (this.expTickLabelsFlag) {
853                                //if flag then
854                                tickLabel = "1e" + i;  //create "1e#"-type label
855                            }
856                            else {    //not "1e#"-type label
857                                if (i >= 0) {   // if positive exponent then
858                                                // make integer
859                                    NumberFormat format
860                                        = getNumberFormatOverride();
861                                    if (format != null) {
862                                        tickLabel = format.format(tickVal);
863                                    }
864                                    else {
865                                        tickLabel = Long.toString((long)
866                                                Math.rint(tickVal));
867                                    }
868                                }
869                                else {
870                                    //negative exponent; create fractional value
871                                    //set exact number of fractional digits to
872                                    // be shown:
873                                    this.numberFormatterObj
874                                        .setMaximumFractionDigits(-i);
875                                    //create tick label:
876                                    tickLabel = this.numberFormatterObj.format(
877                                            tickVal);
878                                }
879                            }
880                        }
881                    }
882                    else {   //not first tick to be displayed
883                        tickLabel = "";     //no tick label
884                    }
885                }
886                else { //not small log values in use; allow for values <= 0
887                    if (zeroTickFlag) {      //if did zero tick last iter then
888                        --j;
889                    }               //decrement to do 1.0 tick now
890                    tickVal = (i >= 0) ? Math.pow(10, i) + (Math.pow(10, i) * j)
891                             : -(Math.pow(10, -i) - (Math.pow(10, -i - 1) * j));
892                    if (j == 0) {  //first tick of group
893                        if (!zeroTickFlag) {     // did not do zero tick last
894                                                 // iteration
895                            if (i > iBegCount && i < iEndCount
896                                    && Math.abs(tickVal - 1.0) < 0.0001) {
897                                // not first or last tick on graph and value
898                                // is 1.0
899                                tickVal = 0.0;        //change value to 0.0
900                                zeroTickFlag = true;  //indicate zero tick
901                                tickLabel = "0";      //create label for tick
902                            }
903                            else {
904                                //first or last tick on graph or value is 1.0
905                                //create label for tick:
906                                if (this.log10TickLabelsFlag) {
907                                       //create "log10"-type label
908                                    tickLabel = (((i < 0) ? "-" : "")
909                                            + "10^" + Math.abs(i));
910                                }
911                                else {
912                                    if (this.expTickLabelsFlag) {
913                                           //create "1e#"-type label
914                                        tickLabel = (((i < 0) ? "-" : "")
915                                                + "1e" + Math.abs(i));
916                                    }
917                                    else {
918                                        NumberFormat format
919                                            = getNumberFormatOverride();
920                                        if (format != null) {
921                                            tickLabel = format.format(tickVal);
922                                        }
923                                        else {
924                                            tickLabel =  Long.toString(
925                                                    (long) Math.rint(tickVal));
926                                        }
927                                    }
928                                }
929                            }
930                        }
931                        else {     // did zero tick last iteration
932                            tickLabel = "";         //no label
933                            zeroTickFlag = false;   //clear flag
934                        }
935                    }
936                    else {       // not first tick of group
937                        tickLabel = "";           //no label
938                        zeroTickFlag = false;     //make sure flag cleared
939                    }
940                }
941
942                if (tickVal > upperBoundVal) {
943                    return ticks;  //if past highest data value then exit method
944                }
945
946                if (tickVal >= lowerBoundVal - SMALL_LOG_VALUE) {
947                    //tick value not below lowest data value
948                    TextAnchor anchor;
949                    TextAnchor rotationAnchor;
950                    double angle = 0.0;
951                    if (isVerticalTickLabels()) {
952                        if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT) {
953                            anchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
954                            rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
955                            angle = -Math.PI / 2.0;
956                        }
957                        else {
958                            anchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
959                            rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
960                            angle = Math.PI / 2.0;
961                        }
962                    }
963                    else {
964                        if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT) {
965                            anchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_RIGHT;
966                            rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_RIGHT;
967                        }
968                        else {
969                            anchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_LEFT;
970                            rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_LEFT;
971                        }
972                    }
973                    //create tick object and add to list:
974                    ticks.add(new NumberTick(tickVal, tickLabel, anchor, 
975                            rotationAnchor, angle));
976                }
977            }
978        }
979        return ticks;
980    }
981
982    /**
983     * Converts the given value to a tick label string.
984     *
985     * @param val the value to convert.
986     * @param forceFmtFlag true to force the number-formatter object
987     * to be used.
988     *
989     * @return The tick label string.
990     */
991    protected String makeTickLabel(double val, boolean forceFmtFlag) {
992        if (this.expTickLabelsFlag || forceFmtFlag) {
993            //using exponents or force-formatter flag is set
994            // (convert 'E' to lower-case 'e'):
995            return this.numberFormatterObj.format(val).toLowerCase();
996        }
997        return getTickUnit().valueToString(val);
998    }
999
1000    /**
1001     * Converts the given value to a tick label string.
1002     * @param val the value to convert.
1003     *
1004     * @return The tick label string.
1005     */
1006    protected String makeTickLabel(double val) {
1007        return makeTickLabel(val, false);
1008    }
1009
1010        public Object clone() throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException {
1011                LogarithmicAxis clone = (LogarithmicAxis) super.clone();
1012                clone.logarithmicAxisProduct = (LogarithmicAxisProduct) this.logarithmicAxisProduct.clone();
1013                return clone;
1014        }
1015
1016}
